NetworkManager-wait-online.service.name: Network Manager Wait Online
NetworkManager-wait-online.service.note: Forces the system to wait for an internet connection. Disabling this significantly speeds up boot time.

ModemManager.service.name: Modem Manager
ModemManager.service.note: Manages 2G/3G/4G modems. Safe to disable if you don't use a USB LTE modem or SIM card.

phpsessionclean.service.name: PHP Session Cleanup
phpsessionclean.service.note: Cleans up expired PHP sessions. Safe to disable if you aren't running a local web server.

smartmontools.service.name: SMART Disk Monitoring
smartmontools.service.note: Monitors hard drive health. Can be disabled for speed, but manual disk checks are advised.

cups.service.name: Printing System (CUPS)
cups.service.note: Common Unix Printing System. If you don't use a printer, disable this to save significant time.

avahi-daemon.service.name: Avahi mDNS/DNS-SD
avahi-daemon.service.note: Discovers devices on local network. Safe to disable if you don't use network printing or file sharing.

NetworkManager.service.name: Network Manager
NetworkManager.service.note: Handles your internet connection. Essential for networking.

udisks2.service.name: Disk Manager
udisks2.service.note: Handles auto-mounting of USB sticks and drives. Disabling it requires manual mounting.

upower.service.name: Power Management
upower.service.note: Monitors battery power and sources. Highly critical for laptop users.

lightdm.service.name: Display Manager (LightDM)
lightdm.service.note: Starts the login screen and GUI. Disabling leaves you in a command-line interface.

gdm.service.name: GNOME Display Manager
gdm.service.note: Graphical login manager for GNOME. Critical for desktop users.

sddm.service.name: Simple Desktop Display Manager
sddm.service.note: Login manager for KDE Plasma and LXQt. Critical for those environments.

systemd-timesyncd.service.name: Network Time Sync
systemd-timesyncd.service.note: Syncs system time with the internet. Important for HTTPS and security logs.

polkit.service.name: Authorization Manager
polkit.service.note: Controls system-wide privileges and permissions. Essential for sudo operations.

sshd.service.name: OpenSSH Daemon
sshd.service.note: Allows remote login via SSH. If you don't access this machine remotely, disable for security.

bluetooth.service.name: Bluetooth Support
bluetooth.service.note: Manages Bluetooth peripherals. Safe to disable if you don't use Bluetooth devices.

apparmor.service.name: AppArmor Security
apparmor.service.note: Security system that restricts program capabilities. Disabling reduces system protection.

ufw.service.name: Uncomplicated Firewall
ufw.service.note: Standard Linux firewall. Disabling exposes your machine to network attacks.

firewalld.service.name: Firewall Daemon
firewalld.service.note: Dynamic firewall manager. Crucial for network security in Fedora/CentOS/RHEL.

cron.service.name: Cron Job Scheduler
cron.service.note: Runs scheduled tasks. Disabling stops automated system maintenance and backups.

lvm2-monitor.service.name: LVM2 Monitor
lvm2-monitor.service.note: Monitors Logical Volume Management. Critical if your disk uses LVM partitions.

accounts-daemon.service.name: Accounts Service
accounts-daemon.service.note: Provides user account information. Necessary for the login screen user list.

dbus.service.name: D-Bus Message Bus
dbus.service.note: Essential communication bridge between system services. Extremely critical.

systemd-journal-flush.service.name: Journal Flush Service
systemd-journal-flush.service.note: Writes boot logs from RAM to disk. Safe but log retrieval might be slower.

docker.service.name: Docker Engine
docker.service.note: Manages containers. If you aren't running containers, disable to save RAM and boot time.

libvirtd.service.name: Virtualization Daemon
libvirtd.service.note: Manages VMs (KVM/QEMU). Safe to disable if you don't use virtualization.

wpa_supplicant.service.name: WPA Supplicant
wpa_supplicant.service.note: Handles Wi-Fi connections and authentication. Essential for wireless networking.

rsyslog.service.name: System Logging
rsyslog.service.note: Legacy logging service. Mostly redundant if journald is active.

irqbalance.service.name: IRQ Balance
irqbalance.service.note: Distributes hardware interrupts across CPU cores. Improves performance on multi-core systems.

unattended-upgrades.service.name: Auto Security Updates
unattended-upgrades.service.note: Installs security patches automatically. Safe to disable if you update manually.

colord.service.name: Color Management
colord.service.note: Manages color profiles for printers and displays. Safe to disable for most users.

networking.service.name: Networking Interface
networking.service.note: Initializes network interfaces during boot. Essential system unit.

plymouth-quit-wait.service.name: Plymouth Exit Wait
plymouth-quit-wait.service.note: Waits for the boot splash to finish. Disabling is safe but may show text flicker.

systemd-udev-trigger.service.name: udev Device Trigger
systemd-udev-trigger.service.note: Detects hardware devices. Disabling will prevent hardware from working.

systemd-journald.service.name: Journal Logging Service
systemd-journald.service.note: Core logging unit for systemd. Vital for system debugging.

systemd-logind.service.name: Login Manager
systemd-logind.service.note: Manages user logins and sessions. Critical for system access.

alsa-restore.service.name: ALSA Audio Restore
alsa-restore.service.note: Restores volume levels on boot. Disabling may reset volume settings.

rtkit-daemon.service.name: RealtimeKit
rtkit-daemon.service.note: Gives real-time priority to audio processes to prevent lag.

asus-pwr-persistence.service.name: Asus Power Persistence
asus-pwr-persistence.service.note: Maintains power settings for Asus laptops. Might affect battery health if disabled.

keyboard-setup.service.name: Keyboard Setup
keyboard-setup.service.note: Configures keyboard layout for the console. Necessary for correct input.

tlp.service.name: TLP Power Management
tlp.service.note: Advanced power management for laptops. Helps extend battery life.

fail2ban.service.name: Fail2Ban Protection
fail2ban.service.note: Protects against brute-force attacks. Recommended if SSH is enabled.

nginx.service.name: Nginx Web Server
nginx.service.note: HTTP web server. Disable if you aren't hosting a website locally.

postgresql.service.name: PostgreSQL Database
postgresql.service.note: Database server. Disable if not in use for development to save resources.

mysql.service.name: MySQL Database
mysql.service.note: Database server. Often slow during boot; disable if not strictly needed.

mariadb.service.name: MariaDB Database
mariadb.service.note: Open-source fork of MySQL. Safe to disable when not coding.

snapd.service.name: Snap Package Manager
snapd.service.note: Manages Snap packages. Safe to disable if you don't use Snap applications.

flatpak-system-helper.service.name: Flatpak Helper
flatpak-system-helper.service.note: Background service for Flatpak apps. Safe to disable if not using Flatpaks.

systemd-resolved.service.name: Network Name Resolution
systemd-resolved.service.note: Core DNS resolver for systemd. Essential for most network setups.

samba.service.name: Samba SMB Daemon
samba.service.note: Handles Windows file sharing. Disable if you don't share files with PCs.

nfs-server.service.name: NFS Server
nfs-server.service.note: Network File System server. Disable if not hosting network drives.

redis.service.name: Redis Store
redis.service.note: In-memory cache. Safe to disable if not used for development.

apache2.service.name: Apache Web Server
apache2.service.note: Traditional web server. Safe to disable if not hosting sites.

exim4.service.name: Exim Mail Server
exim4.service.note: Internal mail transfer agent. Usually unnecessary for desktops.

postfix.service.name: Postfix Mail Server
postfix.service.note: Email server software. Safe to disable if not sending local mail.

rpcbind.service.name: RPCbind Service
rpcbind.service.note: Required for NFS. Safe to disable for most desktop users.

spice-vdagent.service.name: Spice Guest Agent
spice-vdagent.service.note: Used for resolution sync in VMs. Safe to disable on physical hardware.

qemu-guest-agent.service.name: QEMU Guest Agent
qemu-guest-agent.service.note: Helper for VM virtualization. Safe to disable if not in a VM.

vnstat.service.name: vnStat Network Monitor
vnstat.service.note: Tracks network traffic history. Safe to disable to save boot time.

tor.service.name: Tor Onion Router
tor.service.note: Anonymity service. Safe to disable when not using Tor.

openvpn.service.name: OpenVPN Daemon
openvpn.service.note: VPN management service. Safe to disable if not using OpenVPN.

tailscaled.service.name: Tailscale VPN
tailscaled.service.note: Mesh VPN service. Safe to disable if you don't need mesh access.

clamav-freshclam.service.name: ClamAV Update
clamav-freshclam.service.note: Updates antivirus definitions. Safe to disable if scanning manually.

clamav-daemon.service.name: ClamAV Antivirus
clamav-daemon.service.note: Real-time virus scanner. Heavy on resources; safe to disable for speed.

nscd.service.name: Name Service Cache
nscd.service.note: Caches DNS and host lookups. Can be disabled safely.

systemd-networkd.service.name: Systemd Network Daemon
systemd-networkd.service.note: Simple network manager. Used as an alternative to NetworkManager.

systemd-boot-check-no-failures.service.name: Boot Check
systemd-boot-check-no-failures.service.note: Verifies boot success. Important for server health monitoring.

systemd-pstore.service.name: Persistent Storage
systemd-pstore.service.note: Collects kernel crash logs from RAM. Safe to disable for most users.

systemd-oomd.service.name: Out-of-Memory Daemon
systemd-oomd.service.note: Kills processes when RAM is exhausted. Critical for system stability.

gpu-manager.service.name: GPU Manager
gpu-manager.service.note: Detects and configures GPU drivers. Critical for Ubuntu users.

nvidia-persistenced.service.name: Nvidia Persistence
nvidia-persistenced.service.note: Keeps Nvidia drivers loaded. Useful for GPU performance/stability.

thermald.service.name: Thermal Daemon
thermald.service.note: Prevents Intel CPUs from overheating. Recommended for laptops.

whoopsie.service.name: Ubuntu Error Reporting
whoopsie.service.note: Submits crash reports to Canonical. Safe to disable for privacy/speed.

popularity-contest.service.name: Pop-Contest
popularity-contest.service.note: Sends anonymous usage stats to Debian. Safe to disable.

apt-daily.service.name: APT Daily Update
apt-daily.service.note: Updates package lists in the background. Safe to disable if updating manually.

fstrim.service.name: SSD Trim Service
fstrim.service.note: Maintains SSD performance by trimming blocks. Recommended to keep enabled.

speech-dispatcher.service.name: Speech Dispatcher
speech-dispatcher.service.note: Provides text-to-speech support. Safe to disable if not using screen readers.

brltty.service.name: Braille Display Support
brltty.service.note: Support for braille displays. Safe to disable for most users.

pcscd.service.name: Smart Card Daemon
pcscd.service.note: Handles smart card readers. Safe to disable if not using security keys.

packagekit.service.name: PackageKit
packagekit.service.note: High-level package manager used by GUI app stores. Can be disabled.

bolt.service.name: Thunderbolt Device Manager
bolt.service.note: Manages Thunderbolt peripherals. Safe to disable if no Thunderbolt ports.

geoclue.service.name: Location Service
geoclue.service.note: Provides location data to apps. Safe to disable for privacy.

rtkit-daemon.service.name: RealtimeKit
rtkit-daemon.service.note: Coordinates real-time scheduling for audio. Helps prevent audio lag.

auditd.service.name: Audit Daemon
auditd.service.note: Security auditing service. Critical for enterprise/secured systems.

bluetooth-mesh.service.name: Bluetooth Mesh
bluetooth-mesh.service.note: Manages Bluetooth mesh networks. Safe to disable.

canberra-system-bootup.service.name: System Boot Sounds
canberra-system-bootup.service.note: Plays event sounds during boot. Safe to disable.

containerd.service.name: Container Runtime
containerd.service.note: Core container runtime used by Docker. Safe to disable if not using containers.

man-db.service.name: Manual Database
man-db.service.note: Updates the manual page index. Safe to disable for faster boot.

mongod.service.name: MongoDB Database
mongod.service.note: NoSQL database server. Disable if not used for development.

named.service.name: BIND DNS Server
named.service.note: Traditional DNS server. Safe to disable if not running a DNS server.

ntp.service.name: NTP Daemon
ntp.service.note: Traditional time sync. Often replaced by timesyncd.

pipewire.service.name: PipeWire Audio
pipewire.service.note: Modern audio and video stream handler. Essential for most modern desktops.

pipewire-pulse.service.name: PipeWire-Pulse
pipewire-pulse.service.note: PulseAudio compatibility for PipeWire. Critical for audio.

pulseaudio.service.name: PulseAudio
pulseaudio.service.note: Legacy audio server. Critical for systems not yet using PipeWire.

saned.service.name: Scanner Daemon
saned.service.note: Network scanner sharing. Safe to disable if you don't share scanners.

smartd.service.name: SMART Daemon
smartd.service.note: Direct disk monitoring daemon. Safe to disable for speed.

teamviewerd.service.name: TeamViewer Daemon
teamviewerd.service.note: Background service for TeamViewer. Disable if not using remote support.

vboxdrv.service.name: VirtualBox Driver
vboxdrv.service.note: Kernel driver for VirtualBox. Safe to disable if not using VirtualBox.

wireguard.service.name: WireGuard VPN
wireguard.service.note: Modern, fast VPN service. Safe to disable if tunnel not in use.
